intro: Hollia comosa, commonly known as the hairy hollia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 12,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and hairy stems, which give it its common name. Hollia comosa typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a rough texture.
